text23: I am a beginner frontend developer who fell in love with creating web interfaces even before I learned to confidently place commas in HTML. I enjoy turning ideas into working interfaces where design and functionality move in the same rhythm. I especially appreciate convenient user experience, pleasant visual components and neat, understandable code - the kind that is not ashamed to show to a developer friend.
text24: I started my journey recently, but I have already been through pain, joy and 'why is everything white for me?' and 'why is the terminal all red?'. Now I am growing as a developer, strengthening my skills in React, JavaScript, Next.js and other modern tools that help create fast, modern and lively web applications.
text25: When I'm not in the process of hunting for bugs (or when bugs are hunting for me), I study new technologies, get inspired by other developers' projects and collect ideas for my own small pet projects. You can find me on GitHub - there I post my works, experiments and first steps in the profession. And if you want to follow my journey, I will be glad to have new subscribers!
text30: I am not an official developer, but I made a complete copy of this site with working functions and a shopping cart.
text30.1: And, you know, the longer I worked on it, the more I felt like a secret frontend agent - as if no one expected it, but I took and repeated all the functionality to the last button.
text30.2: This project became a great challenge for me: I analyzed the structure, built the logic, finalized the details and made sure that I can create not just beautiful pages, but real working products. Now, when I look at the result, I think: 'Well, that's it, a couple more such projects - and you can officially apply to the League of Super Developers'.
text32: I also made a second full-fledged online store, but for products. In this project, I set up convenient categories, implemented search, added a working cart and made sure that the selection and ordering process went without unnecessary steps.
text32.1: The site turned out to be light and understandable: everything works quickly, and navigation is as simple as possible. And by the way it has dark mode with translation. Come in even if you are a foreigner!)
text32.2: This project gave me good experience in creating large, functional stores for other topics.
text35: Physics Problem Solver - my personal project.
text36: Separately, I want to note my personal project - a physics problem solving site. This is not just a one-time site: I constantly improve it, add new formulas, adjust calculations and refine the interface so that everything works even more accurately and conveniently.
text36.1: Each update is like a small upgrade of superpowers: I saw a new task or formula, figured it out, improved the logic, and the site became smarter. This project for me is like a living organism that grows with my knowledge.
text38: My path began when I entered programming courses in Khujand (Tajikistan) - at Learn IT. I spent a whole year there, and it was not just training: the guys from Learn IT literally held my hand when I first opened React, and pushed me forward when something didn't work out.
text39: The teachers explained in such a way that even the most difficult topics ceased to be scary, and the practice was so intense that it felt like we were already working on real projects. And recently I completed this year of study - with a lot of knowledge, confidence in my abilities and a desire to go further.
text40: To be honest, Learn IT is the place where a beginner ceases to be just a beginner. There you are made into a developer who knows what he is doing. And yes, the atmosphere is also top-notch: support, motivation and a lot of ideas that push you to move higher.
text50: Even when alone, it's important to stay connected with the world...
text51: I create convenient and modern web interfaces, paying attention to every detail.
text52: I love turning ideas into working projects - from online stores to my own tools and services.
text53: I constantly learn, improve my skills and strive to make the web a little better than it was yesterday.
